list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He said he would be leaving at nine o’clock the next morning
I asked if he’d come and mend my television set
I asked him to do it, but he wouldn’t
I thought you would have finished by now.

list_definition.definition: used in speaking of something that will, may or might happen (eg if a certain condition is met)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: If I asked her to the party, would she come?
I would have come to the party if you’d asked me
I’d be happy to help you.

list_definition.definition: used to express a preference, opinion etc politely

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I would do it this way
It’d be a shame to lose the opportunity
I’d prefer to go tomorrow rather than today.

list_definition.definition: used, said with emphasis, to express annoyance

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’ve lost my car-keys – that would happen!
